citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
In the Nubian ibex enclosure, two of the three female Nubian ibex had significantly overgrown hooves that need trimming.
Untrimmed hooves that are causing locomotion hesitancy, difficulties, or lameness may also contribute to joint pain and
arthritis later in life.
Daily observation must be done, and direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian for timely
resolution.
Correct by March 16, 2023

In the indoor housing facility for the Siamang Gibbons, there were resting perches composed of wood. One of the
perches had a hole where a knot had been. This hole's surface was rough and irregular and not amenable to proper
cleaning and sanitizing.
Rough surfaces can collect organic matter and act as a breeding ground for organisms that can cause disease and be a
threat to the animal's health.
Surfaces of housing facilities - including houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility - that
cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when worn or soiled.
Correct by March 16, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
In the Nubian ibex enclosure, two of the three female Nubian ibex had significantly overgrown hooves that need trimming. 
 
Untrimmed hooves that are causing locomotion hesitancy, difficulties, or lameness may also contribute to joint pain and 
arthritis later in life. 
 
Daily observation must be done, and direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate 
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian for timely 
resolution. 
 
Correct by March 16, 2023 
3.75(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
In the indoor housing facility for the Siamang Gibbons, there were resting perches composed of wood.  One of the 
perches had a hole where a knot had been. This hole's surface was rough and irregular and not amenable to proper

cleaning and sanitizing. 
 
 Rough surfaces can collect organic matter and act as a breeding ground for organisms that can cause disease and be a 
threat to the animal's health.   
 
Surfaces of housing facilities - including houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility - that 
cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when worn or soiled. 
 
Correct by March 16, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
